metadata.name: app_reporting__app_version_report
metadata.comment: Each record in this table represents the daily count of deletions and crashes by app_platform, app_name and app_version.

source_relation.name: source_relation
source_relation.comment: The source of the record if the unioning functionality is being used. If not this field will be empty.

date_day.name: date_day
date_day.comment: The date of the report and respective recorded metric(s); follows the format YYYY-MM-DD.

app_platform.name: app_platform
app_platform.comment: The name of the App Platform and will either be 'apple_store' or 'google_play.'

app_version.name: app_version
app_version.comment: The app version of the app that the user is engaging with.

deletions.name: deletions
deletions.comment: A deletion occurs when a user removes your app from their device (User Opt-In only). A value of 0 indicates there were 0 deletions or no values from the source report that day.

crashes.name: crashes
crashes.comment: The number of recorded crashes experienced (User Opt-In only); a value of 0 indicates there were 0 crash reports or no values from the source report that day.

has_stats.label: Has Stats?
has_stats.description: Indicates whether there are statistics for this table

metadata.name: app_reporting__country_report
metadata.comment: Each record in this table represents the daily count of downloads, deletions and page_views by app_platform, app_name, country, region and sub_region.

source_relation.name: source_relation
source_relation.comment: The source of the record if the unioning functionality is being used. If not this field will be empty.

date_day.name: date_day
date_day.comment: The date of the report and respective recorded metric(s); follows the format YYYY-MM-DD.

app_platform.name: app_platform
app_platform.comment: The name of the App Platform and will either be 'apple_store' or 'google_play.'

country_long.name: country_long
country_long.comment: The long country name for this record; a handful of countries will have names specific to the Apple App Store, while most will align completely with ISO-3166 naming conventions.

country_short.name: country_short
country_short.comment: The short 2-character name for this record's country; countries that are not officially included in ISO-3166 are not included. For example, Google Play includes records from two unofficial ISO-3166 countries, XK and AN.

region.name: region
region.comment: The UN Statistics region name assignment. ([Original Source](https://github.com/lukes/ISO-3166-Countries-with-Regional-Codes/blob/master/all/all.csv))

downloads.name: downloads
downloads.comment: The number of times your app has been downloaded onto a user's device. An individual user can have multiple device installs.

deletions.name: deletions
deletions.comment: A deletion occurs when a user removes your app from their device (User Opt-In only). A value of 0 indicates there were 0 deletions or no values from the source report that day.

page_views.name: page_views
page_views.comment: The number of times your app listing was viewed.

has_stats.label: Has Stats?
has_stats.description: Indicates whether there are statistics for this table

metadata.name: apple_store__app_version_report
metadata.comment: Each record represents daily metrics for each by app_id, source_type and app version

source_relation.name: source_relation
source_relation.comment: The source of the record if the unioning functionality is being used. If it is not this field will be empty.

date_day.name: date_day
date_day.comment: The date of the report and respective recorded metric(s); follows the format `YYYY-MM-DD`.

source_type.name: source_type
source_type.comment:
A source is counted when a customer follows a link to your App Store product page. 
There are 8 types of sources: App Store Browse, App Store Search, App Referrers, Web Referrers, App Clips, Unavailable, Institutional Purchases, and Null. Null is the default value for data that does not provide source types, including: crashes, subscription events and subscription summary.
More information can be found in the Apple App Store developer [docs](https://developer.apple.com/help/app-store-connect/view-app-analytics/view-acquisition-sources/).

app_version.name: app_version
app_version.comment: The app version of the app that the user is engaging with.

crashes.name: crashes
crashes.comment: The number of recorded crashes experienced (User Opt-In only); a value of 0 indicates there were 0 crash reports or no value from the source report that day.

active_devices.name: active_devices
active_devices.comment: The count of active_device is the count of devices that ran the app at least one time and for at least two seconds on a given day (User Opt-In only); this metric is presumed to be de-duplicated daily as received from the source data, therefore, aggregating over a span of days is better done in the UI. A value of 0 indicates there were 0 active devices or no value from the source report that day.

active_devices_last_30_days.name: active_devices_last_30_days
active_devices_last_30_days.comment: The count of active_devices_last_30_days is the count of devices that ran the app at least one time and for at least two seconds on the date_day of the report minus 30 days (User Opt-In only); this metric is presumed to be de-duplicated daily as received from the source data, therefore, aggregating over a span of days is better done in the UI. A value of 0 indicates there were 0 active devices last 30 days or no value from the source report that day.

deletions.name: deletions
deletions.comment: A deletion occurs when a user removes your app from their device (User Opt-In only). Data from resetting or erasing a device’s content and settings is not included. A value of 0 indicates there were 0 deletions or no value from the source report that day.

installations.name: installations
installations.comment: An installation event is when the user opens the App after they've downloaded it (User Opt-In only). If the App was downloaded but not opened or opened offline, this will not count; if the user opts out of sending data back to Apple, there will also be no data here. A value of 0 indicates there were 0 installations or no value from the source report that day.

sessions.name: sessions
sessions.comment: Sessions is the count of the number of times the app has been used for at least two seconds (User Opt-In only). If the app is in the background and is later used again, that counts as another session. A value of 0 indicates there were 0 sessions or no value from the source report that day.

has_stats.label: Has Stats?
has_stats.description: Indicates whether there are statistics for this table

metadata.name: apple_store__device_report
metadata.comment: Each record represents daily subscription metrics by app_id, source_type and device

source_relation.name: source_relation
source_relation.comment: The source of the record if the unioning functionality is being used. If it is not this field will be empty.

date_day.name: date_day
date_day.comment: The date of the report and respective recorded metric(s); follows the format `YYYY-MM-DD`.

source_type.name: source_type
source_type.comment:
A source is counted when a customer follows a link to your App Store product page. 
There are 8 types of sources: App Store Browse, App Store Search, App Referrers, Web Referrers, App Clips, Unavailable, Institutional Purchases, and Null. Null is the default value for data that does not provide source types, including: crashes, subscription events and subscription summary.
More information can be found in the Apple App Store developer [docs](https://developer.apple.com/help/app-store-connect/view-app-analytics/view-acquisition-sources/).

device.name: device
device.comment: Device type associated with the respective metric(s).

impressions.name: impressions
impressions.comment: The number of times your app was viewed in the App Store for more than one second. This includes search results, Featured, Explore, Top Charts and App Product Page views. (Source: [BusinessofApps](https://www.businessofapps.com/insights/understanding-the-app-store-metrics/#:~:text=Impressions%20%E2%80%93%20%E2%80%9CThe%20number%20of%20times,was%20clicked%20on%20and%20viewed.))

impressions_unique_device.name: impressions_unique_device
impressions_unique_device.comment: The number of unique devices that have viewed your app for more than one second on on the Today, Games, Apps, Featured, Explore, Top Charts, Search tabs of the App Store and App Product Page views. This metric is presumed to be de-duplicated daily as received from the source data, therefore, aggregating over a span of days is better done in the UI.

page_views.name: page_views
page_views.comment: The total number of times your App Store product page was clicked and viewed; when a user taps on a link from an app, website or App Clip card that brings them to your App Store product page, the immediate product page_view is attributed to the referring app, website, or App Clip. (Sources: [Apple](https://help.apple.com/app-store-connect/#/itcf19c873df), [BusinessofApps](https://www.businessofapps.com/insights/understanding-the-app-store-metrics/#:~:text=Impressions%20%E2%80%93%20%E2%80%9CThe%20number%20of%20times,was%20clicked%20on%20and%20viewed.))

page_views_unique_device.name: page_views_unique_device
page_views_unique_device.comment: The number of unique devices that have viewed your App Store product page; this metric is presumed to be de-duplicated daily as received from the source data, therefore, aggregating over a span of days is better done in the UI.

crashes.name: crashes
crashes.comment: The number of recorded crashes experienced (User Opt-In only); a value of 0 indicates there were 0 crash reports or no value from the source report that day.

first_time_downloads.name: first_time_downloads
first_time_downloads.comment: The number of first time downloads for your app; credit is attributed to the referring app, website, or App Clip of the first time download.

redownloads.name: redownloads
redownloads.comment: The count of redownloads where a redownload occurs when a user who previously downloaded your app adds it to their device again (User Opt-In only); credit is attributed to the source recorded when a user tapped to download/launch your app for the first time. A value of 0 indicates there were 0 redownloads or no value from the source report that day.

total_downloads.name: total_downloads
total_downloads.comment: Total Downloads is the sum of Redownloads and First Time Downloads.

active_devices.name: active_devices
active_devices.comment: The count of active_device is the count of devices that ran the app at least one time and for at least two seconds on a given day (User Opt-In only); this metric is presumed to be de-duplicated daily as received from the source data, therefore, aggregating over a span of days is better done in the UI. A value of 0 indicates there were 0 active devices or no value from the source report that day.

active_devices_last_30_days.name: active_devices_last_30_days
active_devices_last_30_days.comment: The count of active_devices_last_30_days is the count of devices that ran the app at least one time and for at least two seconds on the date_day of the report minus 30 days (User Opt-In only); this metric is presumed to be de-duplicated daily as received from the source data, therefore, aggregating over a span of days is better done in the UI. A value of 0 indicates there were 0 active devices last 30 days or no value from the source report that day.

deletions.name: deletions
deletions.comment: A deletion occurs when a user removes your app from their device (User Opt-In only). Data from resetting or erasing a device’s content and settings is not included. A value of 0 indicates there were 0 deletions or no value from the source report that day.

installations.name: installations
installations.comment: An installation event is when the user opens the App after they've downloaded it (User Opt-In only). If the App was downloaded but not opened or opened offline, this will not count; if the user opts out of sending data back to Apple, there will also be no data here. A value of 0 indicates there were 0 installations or no value from the source report that day.

sessions.name: sessions
sessions.comment: Sessions is the count of the number of times the app has been used for at least two seconds (User Opt-In only). If the app is in the background and is later used again, that counts as another session. A value of 0 indicates there were 0 sessions or no value from the source report that day.

has_stats.label: Has Stats?
has_stats.description: Indicates whether there are statistics for this table

deletions.comment: A deletion occurs when a user removes your app from their device (User Opt-In only). Data from resetting or erasing a device’s content and settings is not included. A value of 0 indicates there were 0 deletions or no value from the source report that day.

installations.name: installations
installations.comment: An installation event is when the user opens the App after they've downloaded it (User Opt-In only). If the App was downloaded but not opened or opened offline, this will not count; if the user opts out of sending data back to Apple, there will also be no data here. A value of 0 indicates there were 0 installations or no value from the source report that day.

sessions.name: sessions
sessions.comment: Sessions is the count of the number of times the app has been used for at least two seconds (User Opt-In only). If the app is in the background and is later used again, that counts as another session. A value of 0 indicates there were 0 sessions or no value from the source report that day.

metadata.name: apple_store__source_type_report
metadata.comment: Each record represents daily metrics by app_id and source_type

source_relation.name: source_relation
source_relation.comment: The source of the record if the unioning functionality is being used. If it is not this field will be empty.

date_day.name: date_day
date_day.comment: The date of the report and respective recorded metric(s); follows the format `YYYY-MM-DD`.

source_type.name: source_type
source_type.comment:
A source is counted when a customer follows a link to your App Store product page. 
There are 8 types of sources: App Store Browse, App Store Search, App Referrers, Web Referrers, App Clips, Unavailable, Institutional Purchases, and Null. Null is the default value for data that does not provide source types, including: crashes, subscription events and subscription summary.
More information can be found in the Apple App Store developer [docs](https://developer.apple.com/help/app-store-connect/view-app-analytics/view-acquisition-sources/).

impressions.name: impressions
impressions.comment: The number of times your app was viewed in the App Store for more than one second. This includes search results, Featured, Explore, Top Charts and App Product Page views. (Source: [BusinessofApps](https://www.businessofapps.com/insights/understanding-the-app-store-metrics/#:~:text=Impressions%20%E2%80%93%20%E2%80%9CThe%20number%20of%20times,was%20clicked%20on%20and%20viewed.))

page_views.name: page_views
page_views.comment: The total number of times your App Store product page was clicked and viewed; when a user taps on a link from an app, website or App Clip card that brings them to your App Store product page, the immediate product page_view is attributed to the referring app, website, or App Clip. (Sources: [Apple](https://help.apple.com/app-store-connect/#/itcf19c873df), [BusinessofApps](https://www.businessofapps.com/insights/understanding-the-app-store-metrics/#:~:text=Impressions%20%E2%80%93%20%E2%80%9CThe%20number%20of%20times,was%20clicked%20on%20and%20viewed.))

first_time_downloads.name: first_time_downloads
first_time_downloads.comment: The number of first time downloads for your app; credit is attributed to the referring app, website, or App Clip of the first time download.

redownloads.name: redownloads
redownloads.comment: The count of redownloads where a redownload occurs when a user who previously downloaded your app adds it to their device again (User Opt-In only); credit is attributed to the source recorded when a user tapped to download/launch your app for the first time. A value of 0 indicates there were 0 redownloads or no value from the source report that day.

total_downloads.name: total_downloads
total_downloads.comment: Total Downloads is the sum of Redownloads and First Time Downloads.

active_devices.name: active_devices
active_devices.comment: The count of active_device is the count of devices that ran the app at least one time and for at least two seconds on a given day (User Opt-In only); this metric is presumed to be de-duplicated daily as received from the source data, therefore, aggregating over a span of days is better done in the UI. A value of 0 indicates there were 0 active devices or no value from the source report that day.

deletions.name: deletions
deletions.comment: A deletion occurs when a user removes your app from their device (User Opt-In only). Data from resetting or erasing a device’s content and settings is not included. A value of 0 indicates there were 0 deletions or no value from the source report that day.

installations.name: installations
installations.comment: An installation event is when the user opens the App after they've downloaded it (User Opt-In only). If the App was downloaded but not opened or opened offline, this will not count; if the user opts out of sending data back to Apple, there will also be no data here. A value of 0 indicates there were 0 installations or no value from the source report that day.

sessions.name: sessions
sessions.comment: Sessions is the count of the number of times the app has been used for at least two seconds (User Opt-In only). If the app is in the background and is later used again, that counts as another session. A value of 0 indicates there were 0 sessions or no value from the source report that day.

metadata.name: google_play__app_version_report
metadata.comment: Daily report on installs, crashes and ANRs, and ratings by app and app_version.  Records with `NULL` app version codes are aggregated together into daily batches.

source_relation.name: source_relation
source_relation.comment: The source of the record if the unioning functionality is being used. If not this field will be empty.

date_day.name: date_day
date_day.comment: The date on which the data is reported.

app_version_code.name: app_version_code
app_version_code.comment: Integer value of the version of the app being reported on.

package_name.name: package_name
package_name.comment: The package name of the app owning the report data.

device_installs.name: device_installs
device_installs.comment: Devices on which users installed your app on this day. An individual user can have multiple device installs.

device_uninstalls.name: device_uninstalls
device_uninstalls.comment: The number of devices from which users uninstalled your app on a given day.

device_upgrades.name: device_upgrades
device_upgrades.comment: The number of devices from which users upgraded your app on a given day.

user_installs.name: user_installs
user_installs.comment: The number of users who installed your app and did not have it installed on any other devices at the time on a given day.

user_uninstalls.name: user_uninstalls
user_uninstalls.comment: The number of users who uninstalled your app from all of their devices on this day.

crashes.name: crashes
crashes.comment: Daily crash reports collected from Android devices whose users have opted in to automatically share usage and diagnostics data.

anrs.name: anrs
anrs.comment: Daily application not responding (ANR) reports collected from Android devices whose users have opted in to automatically share usage and diagnostics data.

install_events.name: install_events
install_events.comment: The number of times your app was installed, including devices on which the app had been installed previously. This does not include pre-installs or device reactivations.

uninstall_events.name: uninstall_events
uninstall_events.comment: The number of times your app was uninstalled. This does not include inactive devices.

update_events.name: update_events
update_events.comment: The number of times your app was updated.

active_devices_last_30_days.name: active_devices_last_30_days
active_devices_last_30_days.comment: The number of active devices on which your app is installed. An active device is one that has been turned on at least once in the past 30 days.

average_rating.name: average_rating
average_rating.comment: Average star rating this app has received across all ratings submitted on a given day.

rolling_total_average_rating.name: rolling_total_average_rating
rolling_total_average_rating.comment: Average star rating this app received across all ratings submitted up to and including the past day. For each user submitting a rating, only their most recent rating of the app is counted.

total_device_installs.name: total_device_installs
total_device_installs.comment: Cumulative number of device installs up to and including this day (aggregated on the dimension of this table). This does not take uninstalls into account and may contain duplicate devices.

total_device_uninstalls.name: total_device_uninstalls
total_device_uninstalls.comment: Cumulative number of device uninstalls up to and including this day (aggregated on the dimension of this table). This does not take re-installs into account and may contain duplicate devices.

net_device_installs.name: net_device_installs
net_device_installs.comment: Cumulative net number of device installs up to and including this day (aggregated on the dimension of this table). This is the difference of `total_device_installs` and `total_device_uninstalls`.

has_stats.label: Has Stats?
has_stats.description: Indicates whether there are statistics for this table

update_events.name: update_events
update_events.comment: The number of times your app was updated.

store_listing_acquisitions.name: store_listing_acquisitions
store_listing_acquisitions.comment: The number of users that visited your store listing and installed your app, who did not have your app installed on any device.

store_listing_visitors.name: store_listing_visitors
store_listing_visitors.comment: The number of users that visited your store listing who did not have your app installed on any device.

store_listing_conversion_rate.name: store_listing_conversion_rate
store_listing_conversion_rate.comment:
The percentage of store listing visitors who installed your app on a given day.

Note: Does not include visits or installs from users who already have your app installed on another device

active_devices_last_30_days.name: active_devices_last_30_days
active_devices_last_30_days.comment: The number of active devices on which your app is installed. An active device is one that has been turned on at least once in the past 30 days.

total_device_uninstalls.name: total_device_uninstalls
total_device_uninstalls.comment: Cumulative number of device uninstalls up to and including this day (aggregated on the dimension of this table). This does not take re-installs into account and may contain duplicate devices.

total_store_acquisitions.name: total_store_acquisitions
total_store_acquisitions.comment: Cumulative number of users that visited your store listing and installed your app, who did not have your app installed on any device prior to this.

total_store_visitors.name: total_store_visitors
total_store_visitors.comment: Cumulative number of users that visited your store listing who did not have your app installed on any device at the time.

rolling_store_conversion_rate.name: rolling_store_conversion_rate
rolling_store_conversion_rate.comment: Rolling percentage of store listing visitors who installed your app within a given country. The ratio of `total_store_acquisitions` to `total_store_visitors`.

net_device_installs.name: net_device_installs
net_device_installs.comment: Cumulative net number of device installs up to and including this day (aggregated on the dimension of this table). This is the difference of `total_device_installs` and `total_device_uninstalls`.

metadata.name: google_play__finance_report
metadata.comment: Daily report on revenue (in merchant currency) and subscriptions by product (defined by 'sku_id') and buyer country.  Includes financial metrics for each type of transaction that your app has completed. Note that this table draws from the `earnings` report and NOT `sales`. The Google Play UI draws from the `sales` data, and therefore this model will NOT tie out with the UI revenue reports. Google recommends using `earnings` data for financial analyses despite this -- `sales` does not include chargebacks and the like, making  it more appropriate for trend analyses than accounting ([source](https://support.google.com/googleplay/android-developer/answer/6135870)).

source_relation.name: source_relation
source_relation.comment: The source of the record if the unioning functionality is being used. If not this field will be empty.

date_day.name: date_day
date_day.comment: The date on which the data is reported.

country_short.name: country_short
country_short.comment: The country associated with the subscription event metrics and subscription summary metric(s). This country code maps to ISO-3166 Alpha-2.

package_name.name: package_name
package_name.comment: The package name of the app owning the report data.

sku_id.name: sku_id
sku_id.comment: Developer-specified unique ID assigned to the ordered product. Subscription order IDs include the renewal cycle number at the end.

merchant_currency.name: merchant_currency
merchant_currency.comment: Currency to which the order was converted. This is the local currency you are paid in.

net_amount.name: net_amount
net_amount.comment: Net amount of revenue summed across the different transaction types.

transactions.name: transactions
transactions.comment: Total number of distinct transactions made.

charge_amount.name: charge_amount
charge_amount.comment: Amount of revenue brought in through `charge` transaction types (ie charging a customer for a subscription).

charge_transactions.name: charge_transactions
charge_transactions.comment: Number of distinct orders of the `charge` transaction type.

google_fee_amount.name: google_fee_amount
google_fee_amount.comment: Amount of revenue paid to Google in fees. Transactions made in the European Economic Area will not include Google fees.

google_fee_transactions.name: google_fee_transactions
google_fee_transactions.comment: Number of distinct transactions of the `charge` transaction type.

new_subscriptions.name: new_subscriptions
new_subscriptions.comment: The daily count of newly purchased subscriptions.

cancelled_subscriptions.name: cancelled_subscriptions
cancelled_subscriptions.comment: The daily count of cancelled subscriptions.

total_active_subscriptions.name: total_active_subscriptions
total_active_subscriptions.comment: The rolling count of active subscriptions of this type in this country.

product_title.name: product_title
product_title.comment: Developer-specified name of the product. Shown in the buyer's locale.

has_stats.label: Has Stats?
has_stats.description: Indicates whether there are statistics for this table

device_uninstalls.comment: The number of devices from which users uninstalled your app on a given day.

device_upgrades.name: device_upgrades
device_upgrades.comment: The number of devices from which users upgraded your app on a given day.

user_installs.name: user_installs
user_installs.comment: The number of users who installed your app and did not have it installed on any other devices at the time on a given day.

user_uninstalls.name: user_uninstalls
user_uninstalls.comment: The number of users who uninstalled your app from all of their devices on this day.

crashes.name: crashes
crashes.comment: Daily crash reports collected from Android devices whose users have opted in to automatically share usage and diagnostics data.

anrs.name: anrs
anrs.comment: Daily application not responding (ANR) reports collected from Android devices whose users have opted in to automatically share usage and diagnostics data.

install_events.name: install_events
install_events.comment: The number of times your app was installed, including devices on which the app had been installed previously. This does not include pre-installs or device reactivations.

uninstall_events.name: uninstall_events
uninstall_events.comment: The number of times your app was uninstalled. This does not include inactive devices.

update_events.name: update_events
update_events.comment: The number of times your app was updated.

active_devices_last_30_days.name: active_devices_last_30_days
active_devices_last_30_days.comment: The number of active devices on which your app is installed. An active device is one that has been turned on at least once in the past 30 days.

average_rating.name: average_rating
average_rating.comment: Average star rating this app has received across all ratings submitted on a given day.

rolling_total_average_rating.name: rolling_total_average_rating
rolling_total_average_rating.comment: Average star rating this app received across all ratings submitted up to and including the past day. For each user submitting a rating, only their most recent rating of the app is counted.

total_device_installs.name: total_device_installs
total_device_installs.comment: Cumulative number of device installs up to and including this day (aggregated on the dimension of this table). This does not take uninstalls into account and may contain duplicate devices.

total_device_uninstalls.name: total_device_uninstalls
total_device_uninstalls.comment: Cumulative number of device uninstalls up to and including this day (aggregated on the dimension of this table). This does not take re-installs into account and may contain duplicate devices.

net_device_installs.name: net_device_installs
net_device_installs.comment: Cumulative net number of device installs up to and including this day (aggregated on the dimension of this table). This is the difference of `total_device_installs` and `total_device_uninstalls`.

store_listing_visitors.name: store_listing_visitors
store_listing_visitors.comment: The number of users that visited your store listing who did not have your app installed on any device.

store_listing_conversion_rate.name: store_listing_conversion_rate
store_listing_conversion_rate.comment:
The percentage of store listing visitors who installed your app on a given day.

Note: Does not include visits or installs from users who already have your app installed on another device

average_rating.name: average_rating

total_device_uninstalls.name: total_device_uninstalls

total_store_acquisitions.name: total_store_acquisitions
total_store_acquisitions.comment: Cumulative number of users that visited your store listing and installed your app, who did not have your app installed on any device prior to this.

total_store_visitors.name: total_store_visitors
total_store_visitors.comment: Cumulative number of users that visited your store listing who did not have your app installed on any device at the time.

rolling_store_conversion_rate.name: rolling_store_conversion_rate

metadata.name: stg_apple_store__app_store_device
metadata.comment: Daily app store metrics (impressions, impressions_unique_device, page_views and page_views_unique_device) by device and source type.

source_relation.name: source_relation
source_relation.comment: The source of the record if the unioning functionality is being used. If it is not this field will be empty.

date_day.name: date_day
date_day.comment: The date of the report and respective recorded metric(s); follows the format `YYYY-MM-DD`.

source_type.name: source_type
source_type.comment:
A source is counted when a customer follows a link to your App Store product page. 
There are 8 types of sources: App Store Browse, App Store Search, App Referrers, Web Referrers, App Clips, Unavailable, Institutional Purchases, and Null. Null is the default value for data that does not provide source types, including: crashes, subscription events and subscription summary.
More information can be found in the Apple App Store developer [docs](https://developer.apple.com/help/app-store-connect/view-app-analytics/view-acquisition-sources/).

device.name: device
device.comment: Device type associated with the respective metric(s).

impressions.name: impressions
impressions.comment: The number of times your app was viewed in the App Store for more than one second. This includes search results, Featured, Explore, Top Charts and App Product Page views. (Source: [BusinessofApps](https://www.businessofapps.com/insights/understanding-the-app-store-metrics/#:~:text=Impressions%20%E2%80%93%20%E2%80%9CThe%20number%20of%20times,was%20clicked%20on%20and%20viewed.))

impressions_unique_device.name: impressions_unique_device
impressions_unique_device.comment: The number of unique devices that have viewed your app for more than one second on on the Today, Games, Apps, Featured, Explore, Top Charts, Search tabs of the App Store and App Product Page views. This metric is presumed to be de-duplicated daily as received from the source data, therefore, aggregating over a span of days is better done in the UI.

page_views.name: page_views
page_views.comment: The total number of times your App Store product page was clicked and viewed; when a user taps on a link from an app, website or App Clip card that brings them to your App Store product page, the immediate product page_view is attributed to the referring app, website, or App Clip. (Sources: [Apple](https://help.apple.com/app-store-connect/#/itcf19c873df), [BusinessofApps](https://www.businessofapps.com/insights/understanding-the-app-store-metrics/#:~:text=Impressions%20%E2%80%93%20%E2%80%9CThe%20number%20of%20times,was%20clicked%20on%20and%20viewed.))

page_views_unique_device.name: page_views_unique_device
page_views_unique_device.comment: The number of unique devices that have viewed your App Store product page; this metric is presumed to be de-duplicated daily as received from the source data, therefore, aggregating over a span of days is better done in the UI.

has_stats.label: Has Stats?
has_stats.description: Indicates whether there are statistics for this table

metadata.name: stg_apple_store__downloads_device
metadata.comment: Daily downloads metrics (first time downloads, redownloads and total downloads) by device and source type.

source_relation.name: source_relation
source_relation.comment: The source of the record if the unioning functionality is being used. If it is not this field will be empty.

date_day.name: date_day
date_day.comment: The date of the report and respective recorded metric(s); follows the format `YYYY-MM-DD`.

source_type.name: source_type
source_type.comment:
A source is counted when a customer follows a link to your App Store product page. 
There are 8 types of sources: App Store Browse, App Store Search, App Referrers, Web Referrers, App Clips, Unavailable, Institutional Purchases, and Null. Null is the default value for data that does not provide source types, including: crashes, subscription events and subscription summary.
More information can be found in the Apple App Store developer [docs](https://developer.apple.com/help/app-store-connect/view-app-analytics/view-acquisition-sources/).

device.name: device
device.comment: Device type associated with the respective metric(s).

first_time_downloads.name: first_time_downloads
first_time_downloads.comment: The number of first time downloads for your app; credit is attributed to the referring app, website, or App Clip of the first time download.

redownloads.name: redownloads
redownloads.comment: The count of redownloads where a redownload occurs when a user who previously downloaded your app adds it to their device again (User Opt-In only); credit is attributed to the source recorded when a user tapped to download/launch your app for the first time. A value of 0 indicates there were 0 redownloads or no value from the source report that day.

total_downloads.name: total_downloads
total_downloads.comment: Total Downloads is the sum of Redownloads and First Time Downloads.

metadata.comment: Daily subscription event report by account ID, app name, subscription name, event, country, state and device; this model is aggregated by date, app_name, account_id, country, state and subscription_name for easier transformations in the modeling package.

source_relation.name: source_relation
source_relation.comment: The source of the record if the unioning functionality is being used. If it is not this field will be empty.

subscription_name.comment: The subscription name associated with the subscription event metric or subscription summary metric.

event.name: event
event.comment: The subscription event associated with the respective metric(s).

country.name: country
country.comment: The country associated with the subscription event metrics and subscription summary metric(s). This country code maps to ISO-3166 Alpha-2.

state.name: state
state.comment: The state associated with the subscription event metrics or subscription summary metrics.

device.name: device
device.comment: Device type associated with the respective metric(s).

metadata.comment: Daily subscription summary report by account ID, app name, country, state and subscription name; this model is aggregated by date, app_name, account_id, country, state and subscription_name for easier transformations in the modeling package.

source_relation.name: source_relation
source_relation.comment: The source of the record if the unioning functionality is being used. If it is not this field will be empty.

date_day.name: date_day

country.name: country

state.name: state

subscription_name.name: subscription_name

active_free_trial_introductory_offer_sub.comment: Total number of introductory offer subscriptions currently in a free trial.

active_pay_as_you_go_introductory_offer_.name: active_pay_as_you_go_introductory_offer_subscriptions

active_standard_price_subscriptions.name: active_standard_price_subscriptions

metadata.name: stg_apple_store__usage_app_version
metadata.comment: Daily usage metrics (active devices, active devices last 30 days, deletions, installations, sessions) by app version and source type.

source_relation.name: source_relation
source_relation.comment: The source of the record if the unioning functionality is being used. If it is not this field will be empty.

date_day.name: date_day
date_day.comment: The date of the report and respective recorded metric(s); follows the format `YYYY-MM-DD`.

source_type.name: source_type
source_type.comment:
A source is counted when a customer follows a link to your App Store product page. 
There are 8 types of sources: App Store Browse, App Store Search, App Referrers, Web Referrers, App Clips, Unavailable, Institutional Purchases, and Null. Null is the default value for data that does not provide source types, including: crashes, subscription events and subscription summary.
More information can be found in the Apple App Store developer [docs](https://developer.apple.com/help/app-store-connect/view-app-analytics/view-acquisition-sources/).

app_version.name: app_version
app_version.comment: The app version of the app that the user is engaging with.

active_devices.name: active_devices
active_devices.comment: The count of active_device is the count of devices that ran the app at least one time and for at least two seconds on a given day (User Opt-In only); this metric is presumed to be de-duplicated daily as received from the source data, therefore, aggregating over a span of days is better done in the UI. A value of 0 indicates there were 0 active devices or no value from the source report that day.

active_devices_last_30_days.name: active_devices_last_30_days
active_devices_last_30_days.comment: The count of active_devices_last_30_days is the count of devices that ran the app at least one time and for at least two seconds on the date_day of the report minus 30 days (User Opt-In only); this metric is presumed to be de-duplicated daily as received from the source data, therefore, aggregating over a span of days is better done in the UI. A value of 0 indicates there were 0 active devices last 30 days or no value from the source report that day.

deletions.name: deletions
deletions.comment: A deletion occurs when a user removes your app from their device (User Opt-In only). Data from resetting or erasing a device’s content and settings is not included. A value of 0 indicates there were 0 deletions or no value from the source report that day.

installations.name: installations
installations.comment: An installation event is when the user opens the App after they've downloaded it (User Opt-In only). If the App was downloaded but not opened or opened offline, this will not count; if the user opts out of sending data back to Apple, there will also be no data here. A value of 0 indicates there were 0 installations or no value from the source report that day.

sessions.name: sessions
sessions.comment: Sessions is the count of the number of times the app has been used for at least two seconds (User Opt-In only). If the app is in the background and is later used again, that counts as another session. A value of 0 indicates there were 0 sessions or no value from the source report that day.

metadata.name: stg_google_play__earnings
metadata.comment: Each line in the report represents a type of transaction, like when you charge a customer money or pay Google a fee, along with the original and converted amounts. Does not include chargebacks. No transactions made in the European Economic Area will not be Google fees.

source_relation.name: source_relation
source_relation.comment: The source of the record if the unioning functionality is being used. If not this field will be empty.

amount_buyer_currency.name: amount_buyer_currency
amount_buyer_currency.comment: Total amount for this invoice line before currency conversion.

amount_merchant_currency.name: amount_merchant_currency
amount_merchant_currency.comment: Total amount for this invoice line after currency conversion.

base_plan_id.name: base_plan_id
base_plan_id.comment: Base plan id of the subscription product.

buyer_country.name: buyer_country
buyer_country.comment: Two-letter abbreviation of the country where the user’s Google account is registered.

buyer_currency.name: buyer_currency
buyer_currency.comment: Currency the order was converted from.

buyer_state.name: buyer_state
buyer_state.comment: State in which the buyer resides.

currency_conversion_rate.name: currency_conversion_rate
currency_conversion_rate.comment: Exchange rate used when converting buyer amounts to payout amounts in merchant currency.

order_id.name: order_id
order_id.comment: Unique ID assigned to this order. Subscription order IDs include the renewal cycle number at the end. Renamed from `description`. One order will have a record for every kind of transaction associated with it.

buyer_hardware.name: buyer_hardware
buyer_hardware.comment: Android device model used to make the purchase. For subscription orders, this refers to the model used for the original purchase.

merchant_currency.name: merchant_currency
merchant_currency.comment: Currency to which the order was converted. This is the local currency you are paid in.

offer_id.name: offer_id
offer_id.comment: ID of the offer used to purchase the product.

package_name.name: package_name
package_name.comment: Package name of the app where the product was sold. Renamed from `product_id`.

product_title.name: product_title
product_title.comment: Developer-specified name of the product. Shown in the buyer's locale.

product_type.name: product_type
product_type.comment: Used to identify the type of product sold. '0' represents the sale of a paid app, '1' represents the sale of an in-app product or subscription.

refund_type.name: refund_type
refund_type.comment: Refunds where the buyer was reimbursed their full spend will be marked as 'Full'. Refunds for part of a user’s payment amount will be marked as 'Partial'.

sku_id.name: sku_id
sku_id.comment: Developer-specified unique ID assigned to the ordered product. Subscription order IDs include the renewal cycle number at the end.

tax_type.name: tax_type
tax_type.comment: Kind of tax for tax lines; null for non-tax lines.

transaction_date.name: transaction_date
transaction_date.comment: Date of this order based on the PDT time zone (in 'MMM DD, YYYY' format).

transaction_pt_timestamp.name: transaction_pt_timestamp
transaction_pt_timestamp.comment: Timestamp (in Pacific Time) of  when the order was placed. This is cast as a `dbt.type_timestamp()` which compiles to a timestamp WITHOUT a timezone.  However, all times reported in Google Play are in Pacific Time.

transaction_timezone.name: transaction_timezone
transaction_timezone.comment: Timezone in which the order was placed (PDT or PST).

transaction_type.name: transaction_type
transaction_type.comment: Type of transaction - Charge, Google fee, Tax, Charge refund, Google fee refund, Charge rebill, Tax rebill, Google fee rebill, etc. Nulls are coalesced into 'Other'

metadata.name: stg_google_play__stats_installs_os_version
metadata.comment: Each line is a daily snapshot of the monthly installs report by app and user OS version. Records with `NULL` os versions are aggregated together into daily batches.

source_relation.name: source_relation
source_relation.comment: The source of the record if the unioning functionality is being used. If not this field will be empty.

date_day.name: date_day
date_day.comment: The date on which the data is reported.

package_name.name: package_name
package_name.comment: The package name of the app owning the report data.

android_os_version.name: android_os_version
android_os_version.comment: Operation System of the android being used. May be NULL if users do not consent to being tracked.

active_devices_last_30_days.name: active_devices_last_30_days
active_devices_last_30_days.comment: The number of active devices on which your app is installed. An active device is one that has been turned on at least once in the past 30 days.

device_installs.name: device_installs
device_installs.comment: Devices on which users installed your app on this day. An individual user can have multiple device installs.

device_uninstalls.name: device_uninstalls
device_uninstalls.comment: The number of devices from which users uninstalled your app on a given day.

device_upgrades.name: device_upgrades
device_upgrades.comment: The number of devices from which users upgraded your app on a given day.

user_installs.name: user_installs
user_installs.comment: The number of users who installed your app and did not have it installed on any other devices at the time on a given day.

user_uninstalls.name: user_uninstalls
user_uninstalls.comment: The number of users who uninstalled your app from all of their devices on this day.

install_events.name: install_events
install_events.comment: The number of times your app was installed, including devices on which the app had been installed previously. This does not include pre-installs or device reactivations.

uninstall_events.name: uninstall_events
uninstall_events.comment: The number of times your app was uninstalled. This does not include inactive devices.

update_events.name: update_events
update_events.comment: The number of times your app was updated.

has_stats.description: Indicates whether there are statistics for this table

metadata.name: stg_google_play__stats_ratings_app_version
metadata.comment: Each line is a daily snapshot of the monthly ratings report by app and app version. Records with `NULL` app version codes are aggregated together into daily batches.

source_relation.name: source_relation
source_relation.comment: The source of the record if the unioning functionality is being used. If not this field will be empty.

date_day.name: date_day
date_day.comment: The date on which the data is reported.

app_version_code.name: app_version_code
app_version_code.comment: Integer value of the version of the app being reported on.

package_name.name: package_name
package_name.comment: The package name of the app owning the report data.

average_rating.name: average_rating
average_rating.comment: Average star rating this app has received across all ratings submitted on a given day.

rolling_total_average_rating.name: rolling_total_average_rating
rolling_total_average_rating.comment: Average star rating this app received across all ratings submitted up to and including the past day. For each user submitting a rating, only their most recent rating of the app is counted.

metadata.name: stg_google_play__store_performance_country
metadata.comment: Each line is a daily snapshot of the monthly store performance report by app and country. Records with `NULL` countries are aggregated together into daily batches.

source_relation.name: source_relation
source_relation.comment: The source of the record if the unioning functionality is being used. If not this field will be empty.

date_day.name: date_day
date_day.comment: The date on which the data is reported.

country_region.name: country_region
country_region.comment: Two-letter abbreviation of the country or region where the user’s Google account is registered.

package_name.name: package_name
package_name.comment: The package name of the app owning the report data.

store_listing_acquisitions.name: store_listing_acquisitions
store_listing_acquisitions.comment: The number of users that visited your store listing and installed your app, who did not have your app installed on any device.

store_listing_conversion_rate.name: store_listing_conversion_rate
store_listing_conversion_rate.comment:
The percentage of store listing visitors who installed your app on a given day.

Note: Does not include visits or installs from users who already have your app installed on another device

store_listing_visitors.name: store_listing_visitors
store_listing_visitors.comment: The number of users that visited your store listing who did not have your app installed on any device.

metadata.name: stg_google_play__store_performance_source
metadata.comment: Each line is a daily snapshot of the monthly store performance report by app and type of traffic source.

source_relation.name: source_relation
source_relation.comment: The source of the record if the unioning functionality is being used. If not this field will be empty.

date_day.name: date_day
date_day.comment: The date on which the data is reported.

package_name.name: package_name
package_name.comment: The package name of the app owning the report data.

traffic_source.name: traffic_source
traffic_source.comment: How the user got to your store listing: Google Play search, Third-party referral, Google Play explore, or Other.

search_term.name: search_term
search_term.comment:
The term the user searched for before navigating to your store listing. Only available when the traffic source is Google Play search.
Note: Can be Other this value does not reach certain minimum thresholds

utm_campaign.name: utm_campaign
utm_campaign.comment:
The value of the utm_campaign URL parameter in deep links to your store listing. Only available when the traffic source is a third-party referral.
Note: Can be Other this value does not reach certain minimum thresholds

utm_source.name: utm_source
utm_source.comment:
The value of the utm_source URL parameter in deep links to your store listing. Only available when the traffic source is a third-party referral.
Note: Can be Other this value does not reach certain minimum thresholds

store_listing_acquisitions.name: store_listing_acquisitions
store_listing_acquisitions.comment: The number of users that visited your store listing and installed your app, who did not have your app installed on any device.

store_listing_conversion_rate.name: store_listing_conversion_rate
store_listing_conversion_rate.comment:
The percentage of store listing visitors who installed your app on a given day.

Note: Does not include visits or installs from users who already have your app installed on another device

store_listing_visitors.name: store_listing_visitors
store_listing_visitors.comment: The number of users that visited your store listing who did not have your app installed on any device.

metadata.name: stg_google_play__subscriptions_country
metadata.comment: Each line is a daily snapshot of the monthly subscriptions report by individual country, app, and subscription product. Records with `NULL` countries are aggregated together into daily batches.

source_relation.name: source_relation
source_relation.comment: The source of the record if the unioning functionality is being used. If not this field will be empty.

date_day.name: date_day
date_day.comment: The date on which the data is reported.

country.name: country
country.comment: Two-letter abbreviation of the country where the user’s Google account is registered.

product_id.name: product_id
product_id.comment: Developer-specified unique ID assigned to the ordered product. Subscription order IDs include the renewal cycle number at the end.

package_name.name: package_name
package_name.comment: The package name of the app owning the report data.

total_active_subscriptions.name: total_active_subscriptions
total_active_subscriptions.comment: The rolling count of active subscriptions of this type in this country.

cancelled_subscriptions.name: cancelled_subscriptions
cancelled_subscriptions.comment: The daily count of cancelled subscriptions.

new_subscriptions.name: new_subscriptions
new_subscriptions.comment: The daily count of newly purchased subscriptions.
